questions.question: They are painting the walls. (Active) / The walls ………………. (Passive)
questions.description: In the present continuous tense, the passive form is ‘is/am/are + being + past participle form of the verb’

questions.question: He closed the door. (Active) / The door …………………. by him. (Passive)
questions.description: In the simple past tense, the passive form is ‘was/were + past participle form of the verb’

questions.question: The loan recovery officials sealed the house. (Active) / The house …………………. by the loan recovery officials. (Passive)
questions.description: In the simple past tense, the passive form is ‘was/were + past participle form of the verb’

questions.question: I have cleaned the carpets. (Active) / The carpets …………………. (Passive)
questions.description: In the present perfect tense, the passive voice is ‘has/have + been + past participle form of the verb’.

questions.question: I had sent the parcel in the morning. (Active) / The parcel ……………….. in the morning. (Passive)
questions.description: In the past perfect tense, the passive form is ‘had + been + past participle form of the verb’.

questions.question: You should post this letter. (Active) /  This letter ………………… (Passive)
questions.description: ‘Should post’ becomes ‘should be posted’ in the passive voice.

questions.question: They will announce the results tomorrow. (Active) / The results ………………… tomorrow. (Passive)
questions.description: In the simple future tense, the passive form is ‘will + be + past participle form of the verb’.

questions.question: I have fed the dog. (Active) / The dog ………………. (Passive)
questions.description: In the present perfect tense, the passive form is ‘has / have + been + past participle form of the verb’.

questions.question: We will have finished the work by Monday. (Active) / The work ………………… by Monday. (Passive)
questions.description: In the future perfect tense, the passive form is ‘will + have + been + past participle form of the verb’.

questions.question: The reporter is announcing the news. (Active) / The news ……………….. (Passive)
questions.description: In the present continuous tense, the passive form is ‘is/am/are + being + past participle form of the verb’.

questions.question: They took the patient to the hospital in an ambulance. (Active) / The patient ………………. to the hospital in an ambulance. (Passive)
questions.description: In the simple past tense, the passive form is ‘was/were + past participle form of the verb’

questions.question: I bought food at the restaurant. (Active) / Food ……………… at the restaurant. (Passive)
